elements.title: Are you worried about your safety or the safety of your children?

elements.name: EmergencyInstructions
elements.title:
Call 9-1-1 if you or your children are in immediate danger.

If you are not in immediate danger but are still afraid for your safety, VictimLinkBC can help you develop a safety plan.

VictimLinkBC is a confidential, multilingual telephone service available 24 hours a day, 7 days a week. Victim service workers can provide crisis support, information and referrals to supports including safety planning, victim services, transition houses and counselling services. Even with a protection order in place, it is a good idea to have a personal safety plan.

Call: 1-800-563-0808 | TTY: 604-875-0885 | Text: 604-863-6381 | Email: VictimLinkBC@bc211.ca

To exit this service quickly

To exit immediately, click the
Quick Exit
button at the top right corner of the screen and delete it from your browser history. When you exit, it will take you to a Google search page.

If a family member is making you or your children feel unsafe, you can apply to the court for a Protection Order (if you don't already have one in place). To apply, return to the [previous] screen and select Protection from family violence. This service can assist you in preparing the forms to make this application.

If someone who is not a family member is making you or your children feel unsafe, you can apply to the court for an order to protect you. This order is called a Peace Bond. This service cannot be used to get a Peace Bond. If you think you need a Peace Bond, contact the police or RCMP for assistance.

elements.name: EmergencyInstructions
elements.title:
You may feel safe now. People can be most at risk of family violence when they first separate or at the start of a legal process.

For these reasons, you may want to consider developing a personal safety plan. VictimLinkBC can help you develop a safety plan.

Call: 1-800-563-0808 | TTY: 604-875-0885 | Text: 604-863-6381 | Email: VictimLinkBC@bc211.ca
